hints.content: To divide a shape in thirds, we divide the whole into **$3$ equal parts**.

These circles are divided into $3$ pieces, but the pieces are not equal in size:  

![A circle has 2 parallel lines passing through it. The lines divide the circle in 3 slices.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e015e3190bb69a2e44433a5622d7b912e8f6490e)

![A circle has 2 parallel lines passing through it. The lines divide the circle in 3 slices.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4c080e44636bbb5c431defbace2dafda1b6f91d1)

This circle is divided into $4$ pieces:  

![A circle has two lines passing through the center dividing it into 4 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/00de5ec2f0e315b1328706a6fbde11ccb15ba387)

This circle is divided into thirds:  

![A circle divided into 3 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c5ab24bfbace75da4019aaba2f3873ac4fcd89be)

question.content:
**Which circle is divided into thirds?**
